posts.post_content: Throw a [Primal Cocoon](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Primal Cocoon) on this. Since both abilities trigger at the same time, you can choose to have the counter resolve first, then immediately move it to whatever you want. You can even put counters on your opponent's creatures to use [Cytoplast Manipulator](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Cytoplast Manipulator).

posts.post_content: This is the center of my Green deck. An excellent, and under-appreciated card. Goes great with [Forcemage Advocate](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Forcemage Advocate), [Spike Feeder](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Spike Feeder), [Algae Gharial](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Algae Gharial), and can work wonders in decks with lots of low 1 or 2 drops. The counters just stack.

posts.post_content:
[Doubling Season](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Doubling Season). Despite the "no mentioning Doubling Season" rule, I think we should make exceptions for cards that are doubly (read: quadruply) good with Doubling Season.
  
   
If you have two of these out with a Doubling Season, you could move counters from one to the other every turn, essentially doubling the number of counters you have each turn without having to cast a spell.
posts.html:
Doubling Season. Despite the "no mentioning Doubling Season" rule, I think we should make exceptions for cards that are doubly (read: quadruply) good with Doubling Season.

If you have two of these out with a Doubling Season, you could move counters from one to the other every turn, essentially doubling the number of counters you have each turn without having to cast a spell.
